title: Holiday Season Shows Strong Sales in 2024
author: Dmitriy Peregudov

text: The data is in as we move past the bustling 2024 holiday season. This makes it clear that e-commerce has maintained growth and opened new opportunities for global businesses to reach consumers, business partners, and work-from-home employees. At Gift Baskets Overseas and Giftsenda, we’ve seen firsthand how shifting consumer behavior and technological advancements have paved the way for a more connected and lucrative global marketplace in 2025 and beyond.Record-breaking sales across bordersHoliday sales in 2024 exceeded expectations, driven by several key factors. These include increased consumer confidence and an enduring reliance on digital shopping experiences. For many, the convenience of online shopping is an expectation and nearly a way of life. The international gift-giving space highlighted this trend, where our ability to offer seamless delivery of premium gift baskets and personalized products worldwide has become a growing demand.Globally, e-commerce sales increased during the holiday season, with regions like Europe, Asia, and North America showing powerful sales. Gift-giving, a cornerstone of the holidays, is one area where digital platforms have uniquely excelled, allowing consumers to easily send curated gifts that span continents.This trend is further evidenced by the continued success of multi-channel strategies that integrate social commerce. Platforms like Instagram and Facebook have enhanced customer engagement, directly driving purchases. We believe this alignment between social media and e-commerce platforms will only grow, making 2025 a year primed for expansion across all types of digital sales channels.E-commerce’s expanding global reachThe convenience of shopping from the comfort of one’s home has been a hallmark of online commerce for years, and cross-border gifting has exploded in 2024. In my businesses, we saw significant growth in markets we had previously identified as emerging. This tracks trends reported by other similar companies. Increased global nomadic lifestyles and cross-border relationships likely contribute to this. Consumers are no longer confined to local or regional marketplaces. Now, they’re shopping globally, driving more opportunities for brands to engage with international customers and make an impact worldwide.Moreover, new logistics and inventory management technologies have enabled us to respond quicker and more efficiently to this demand. This ensures that gift deliveries are timely despite global challenges, such as geopolitical shifts and supply chain complexities. As a result, we’re looking at 2025 as a year where domestic and international gift sales will continue to grow.Why the momentum will continue into 2025Looking ahead, it’s clear that the global e-commerce sector has reached a tipping point. In 2024, we’ve seen that consumers prioritized convenience, personal experiences, and the ability to connect with loved ones worldwide. We believe these same trends will continue into 2025, and the outlook for global digital retail is incredibly bright.For companies focused on global e-commerce, focusing on the key factors below will continue to drive growth:Technology advancements: Technology is the key to unlocking the future for any e-commerce business. From AI-powered recommendation engines to improved global payment solutions, features like these improve how companies interact with customers and how products are delivered. Building upon your technological infrastructure and offerings will enhance the customer experience and streamline operations in new and exciting ways.Increased mobile shopping: As mobile technology continues improving, consumers are increasingly relying on their phones for purchasing. This shift is crucial for businesses as they adapt their strategies to cater to on-the-go buyers who want an instant, frictionless shopping experience. User-friendly shopping apps, with features like one-click purchasing and personalized recommendations, are key to engaging younger demographics, who demand more than a mobile-friendly website.Personalized, global experiences: Consumers crave unique, customized products and experiences. International e-commerce businesses that can provide these tailored services at scale will thrive in 2025. Companies must continue innovating in global service, offering localized options, customizations, and easy access to worldwide shipping.Sustainability and ethical practices: As consumer values evolve and information on business practices become easier to find and more transparent, companies will increasingly be held accountable for their environmental and ethical practices. html:
The data is in as we move past the bustling 2024 holiday season. This makes it clear that e-commerce has maintained growth and opened new opportunities for global businesses to reach consumers, business partners, and work-from-home employees. At Gift Baskets Overseas and Giftsenda, we’ve seen firsthand how shifting consumer behavior and technological advancements have paved the way for a more connected and lucrative global marketplace in 2025 and beyond.

Record-breaking sales across borders

Holiday sales in 2024 exceeded expectations, driven by several key factors. These include increased consumer confidence and an enduring reliance on digital shopping experiences. For many, the convenience of online shopping is an expectation and nearly a way of life. The international gift-giving space highlighted this trend, where our ability to offer seamless delivery of premium gift baskets and personalized products worldwide has become a growing demand.

Globally, e-commerce sales increased during the holiday season, with regions like Europe, Asia, and North America showing powerful sales. Gift-giving, a cornerstone of the holidays, is one area where digital platforms have uniquely excelled, allowing consumers to easily send curated gifts that span continents.

This trend is further evidenced by the continued success of multi-channel strategies that integrate social commerce. Platforms like Instagram and Facebook have enhanced customer engagement, directly driving purchases. We believe this alignment between social media and e-commerce platforms will only grow, making 2025 a year primed for expansion across all types of digital sales channels.

E-commerce’s expanding global reach

The convenience of shopping from the comfort of one’s home has been a hallmark of online commerce for years, and cross-border gifting has exploded in 2024. In my businesses, we saw significant growth in markets we had previously identified as emerging. This tracks trends reported by other similar companies. Increased global nomadic lifestyles and cross-border relationships likely contribute to this. Consumers are no longer confined to local or regional marketplaces. Now, they’re shopping globally, driving more opportunities for brands to engage with international customers and make an impact worldwide.

Moreover, new logistics and inventory management technologies have enabled us to respond quicker and more efficiently to this demand. This ensures that gift deliveries are timely despite global challenges, such as geopolitical shifts and supply chain complexities. As a result, we’re looking at 2025 as a year where domestic and international gift sales will continue to grow.

Why the momentum will continue into 2025

Looking ahead, it’s clear that the global e-commerce sector has reached a tipping point. In 2024, we’ve seen that consumers prioritized convenience, personal experiences, and the ability to connect with loved ones worldwide. We believe these same trends will continue into 2025, and the outlook for global digital retail is incredibly bright.

For companies focused on global e-commerce, focusing on the key factors below will continue to drive growth:

Technology advancements: Technology is the key to unlocking the future for any e-commerce business. From AI-powered recommendation engines to improved global payment solutions, features like these improve how companies interact with customers and how products are delivered. Building upon your technological infrastructure and offerings will enhance the customer experience and streamline operations in new and exciting ways.

Increased mobile shopping: As mobile technology continues improving, consumers are increasingly relying on their phones for purchasing. This shift is crucial for businesses as they adapt their strategies to cater to on-the-go buyers who want an instant, frictionless shopping experience. User-friendly shopping apps, with features like one-click purchasing and personalized recommendations, are key to engaging younger demographics, who demand more than a mobile-friendly website.

Personalized, global experiences: Consumers crave unique, customized products and experiences. International e-commerce businesses that can provide these tailored services at scale will thrive in 2025. Companies must continue innovating in global service, offering localized options, customizations, and easy access to worldwide shipping.

Sustainability and ethical practices: As consumer values evolve and information on business practices become easier to find and more transparent, companies will increasingly be held accountable for their environmental and ethical practices. E-commerce businesses must embrace sustainable sourcing, packaging, and shipping practices while being proactively transparent about their efforts to appeal to the growing environmentally conscious consumer.

The future of global e-commerce

The success of the 2024 holiday season signals the immense potential for global e-commerce in the years ahead. The trends and behaviors we’ve witnessed this past holiday season will set the stage for continued growth in 2025. This will pave the way for even more opportunities for international businesses to connect with customers globally.

As the CEO of international gifting firms, I remain excited and optimistic about the future.

Now is the time for businesses looking to thrive in this evolving environment to invest in technology, expand globally, and think long term about engaging with an increasingly digital and international consumer base. The global e-commerce revolution is here, and the 2024 holiday season has shown that the sky’s the limit.
